articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: The sanctions include freezing any U.S. assets of those designated and barring them and their families from visiting the United States.
articles.title: Trump imposes sanctions on International Criminal Court

articles.author: Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: Thousands of victims of modern slavery are being denied support because of Britain's crackdown on illegal migration, according to more than a dozen sources, a decade after the approval of legislation that put the country at the forefront of the global fight against human trafficking.
articles.title: Insight: UK's tougher immigration policy risks trapping victims in modern slavery

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump meets Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba for the first time on Friday as two allies wary of China's rise work to boost business and security ties while an escalating trade war threatens to rupture the global economy.
articles.title: Trump meets Japan's Ishiba as China trade war simmers

articles.author: Jaimi Dowdell, Lena Masri, Giulia Paravicini, Ryan Mcneill, Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: The Trump administration’s effort to slash and reshape American foreign aid is crippling the intricate global system that aims to prevent and respond to famine.
articles.title: Halt in U.S. aid cripples global efforts to relieve hunger

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio will visit Israel and Arab states in mid-February, a State Department official said, making his first to the Middle East after a widely condemned proposal by President Donald Trump to displace Palestinians in Gaza.
articles.title: Rubio to visit Middle East after Trump proposal for US to take over Gaza

articles.author: Feisal Omar
articles.description: Forces from Somalia's semi-autonomous Puntland region have captured swathes of territory from Islamic State during a weeks-long offensive they hope will draw increased international support, according to officials and Reuters reporters.
articles.title: Puntland offensive deals blow to Islamic State in Somalia

articles.author: Bing Lok
articles.description: Singapore's disgraced former transport minister S. Iswaran, jailed last year for obstructing justice and receiving more than $300,000 of gifts, will serve the remainder of his sentence under house arrest, the prisons service said on Friday.
articles.title: Singapore grants house arrest to jailed former minister S. Iswaran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China is opposed to U.S. "smearing and sabotage" of the Belt and Road Initiative in Panama through "pressure and coercion", its foreign ministry said on Friday, after the South American nation decided to exit the programme.
articles.title: China blames US 'sabotage' for Panama's departure from Belt and Road initiative

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.N. human rights chief said on Friday that he was deeply disturbed by the escalating crisis in eastern Congo, urging all those with influence to help halt the violence and warning of a risk that it spreads beyond the country's borders.
articles.title: UN rights chief warns of spread of Congo crisis at emergency UN meeting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) must be able to pursue its fight against global impunity without hindrance, said European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Friday.
articles.title: EU's Von der Leyen: ICC must be able to pursue fight against global impunity
